ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:0.2_0: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:0.5_0: The training rule on twelve years of seniority
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.2_0: At that time nuns who had twelve years of seniority were giving the full admission without being approved by the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.4_0: They don’t know what is allowable and what is not.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.6_0: They don’t know what is allowable and what is not.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.7_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.8_0: “How can nuns who have twelve years of seniority give the full admission without being approved by the Sangha?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.15_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.16_0: “Monks, approval is required for a nun who has twelve years of seniority to give the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.17_0: And the designation should be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.18_0: After approaching the Sangha of nuns, that nun who has twelve years of seniority should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.19_0: ‘Venerables, I, the nun so-and-so who has twelve years of seniority, ask the Sangha for approval to give the full admission.’
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.20_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.21_0: And they should ask a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.22_0: The Sangha should then decide whether that nun is competent and has a sense of conscience.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.23_0: If she is ignorant and shameless, approval should not be given.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.24_0: If she is ignorant but has a sense of conscience, approval should not be given.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.25_0: If she is competent but shameless, approval should not be given.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.26_0: If she is competent and has a sense of conscience, approval should be given.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.27_0: And the designation should be given like this.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.28_0: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.29_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.30_0: The nun so-and-so who has twelve years of seniority asks the Sangha for approval to give the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.31_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.33_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.34_0: The nun so-and-so who has twelve years of seniority asks the Sangha for approval to give the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.35_0: The Sangha gives approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.36_0: Any nun who approves of giving approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.37_0: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.38_0: The Sangha has given approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.39_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.40_0: Then, after rebuking those nuns in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.41_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:1.42.1_0: ‘If a nun who has twelve years of seniority gives the full admission without approval from the Sangha, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.5_0: Who has twelve years of seniority:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.6_0: who has reached twelve years of seniority.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.8_0: who has been given the full ordination through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements, but which has not been given a motion.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.11_0: If, intending to give full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastic boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.12_0: for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.13_0: and the last announcement is made by two announcements.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.14_0: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.15_0: while the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.16.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.17_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.18_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.19_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.20_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.21_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.23_0: if she has twelve years of seniority, has been approved by the Sangha, and then gives the full admission;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.25_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc75:2.26_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
